reviewText: Beethoven's Christmas Adventure is the 6th in a long lasting series. Can you believe the very first movie, Beethoven, came out almost 20 years ago in 1992?!?!? (Wow - do I feel old!) Over the years, there has been:  Beethoven's 2nd  Beethoven's 3rd  Beethoven's 4th  Beethoven's 5th  Beethoven's Big Break I'm always a sucker for the first movie in the series, but I've got a surprise for you...in Beethoven's Christmas Adventure, Beethoven finally speaks! Your kids will love it :) How can you resist this sweet, large slobbering St. Bernard and his quest to save Christmas? My son and I watched the movie together this morning and he was just glued to the TV. He really got a kick out of the lost elf and of course, Beethoven. (and I got a few good chuckles in there too!) Beethoven's Christmas Adventure, I'm sure, will turn into a Christmas favorite in the years to come, for him :)

Sequels..and sequels...and sequels to kinda mediocre movies anyway aren't usually great.  Beethoven's Christmas is no exception.  My 8 year old daughter loves Beethoven and any dog movie every made.  She loves Christmas.  So Beethoven and Christmas...she had to have it.  She likes it and has watched it over and over.  She usually watches it in the mini-van dvd player for long rides (cringing).  So I listen to the dialogue and music and barking for over an hour and grip the steering wheel tighter.  The plot to the movie is stupid, the characters don't act well, there's lots of dog barking.  I'm not a fan.  She is though. So if you don't plan on watching this as a family movie, it might work out fine.
Somewhat predictable but good family flick.

Could have been a much better movie, but it just had to include the gratuitous fart joke scenes, (Beethoven and another dog in a farting contest as the Elf holds his nose and waves away the bad air; very clever), as well as Beethoven telling the mom to "Get your nose out of your butt crack". Great. These are things we teach our son that it is not alright to do/say. It seems like every kids' movie made in the last fifteen years has to have the obligatory raunch, so your six year old can learn that it's cool and funny to be rude and gross. (Don't even get me started on Mike Meyer's "The Cat in the Hat". I think I hear Dr. Seuss spinning in his grave...).

There is also a very weird out-tro scene of a kid getting his skateboard forcibly stolen by some older kids, as he skates through the Christmas decorated town. He is left alone in the street yelling "Oh, the injustice". My wife and I were left scratching our heads at this one, and our six year old son even said "That was weird". Merry Christmas, kid. We'll be sticking to the classic Burl Ives Rudolph, and the 1940's classics.

I love Beethoven and this is a great family and christmas movie Its fun to watch and great spirit of christmas. i would recommend this to anyone that likes good chirstmas movies
The kids and adults enjoyed this over the holiday break (the women enjoyed not watching sports for a while).  Cheery and cute for Christmas.

This is a great movie for all ages.  For children, there is no mention of Santa Claus; Beethoven (a dog) is the one that is  in the Christmas sleigh in this movie.  There are interesting/humorous adventures of Beethoven with an elf that helps deliver gifts on Christmas eve.  Overall, this is a family movie that all people should enjoy.

It is about a movie star dog that finds a Christmas elf and he, the elf, and a boy have to save Santa's magic toy bag from a greedy toy store keeper that steals all his toys from other stores before the bag runs out and their are no more toys for Santa to give away.

Beethoven is the supporting cast in a movie about a widow, her teenage son and an advertising campaign for the ASPCA.  The movie has little of the charm of the earlier Beethoven movies.  Preteens will get a few chuckles from this, but this is not a movie for kids who still believe in Santa.

I rated it only two stars for the thin plot, poor acting, and blatant advertising.  I've been adopted by shelter dogs, heartily support pet adoption, but this movie was just awful.  Definitely overpriced as well.
this was a funny good family movie and i loved how there were Naruto posters and Naruto things in his room! Overall I think it was a good family movie I totally reccomend.
Love all the Beethoven movies, funny and good for keeping kids interest. Super choice for all ages 2 to 100

This DVD was for my daughters French Bull Dog named Mojo. This great dog is 2 yrs. old & loves to watch TV. She has her own set of DVD's. No one can believe how she will sit & watch these movies. She loves Beethovens a lot! I watched it with her.........

And lo and behold, Grandma sent it to him. He watched it a several times throughout the Christmas holiday. It is worth the purchase to give to a grandchild when you don't know what else to give them.

Kid movies, especially in the direct to DVD variety like this one, are pretty formulaic, but that doesn't mean that they aren't going to entertain your family.

This movie includes the following predictable plot elements -- parent whose work gets more attention than their children and evil criminals. Add a real-life Christmas elf who falls out of the sled, losing Santa's magic toy bag, and a big slobbery Saint Bernard, and you've got elements that kids will enjoy.

In this movie Beethoven and the stray dog that tags along for this adventure can talk -- sort of. You see, the elf is actually a stable elf who takes care of the reindeer and all animals at the North pole, so he is able to understand dogs. Hearing the dogs talk added a lot of humor and some heart to the movie, and I appreciated the way this plot twist was presented.

CONTENT NOTE: I like to alert parents to plot elements that some choose to avoid. There are some passing gas joking (from dogs), and before the teen learns to "believe" he tells the Christmas Elf who has come straight from the North Pole that believing in Santa is kid stuff, but my 7-year-old didn't blink an eye at that.

Not what i expected & I loved Beethoven as a kid. I was excited when this came out. Especially the fact That Beethoven could talk . in this one. unfortunately it was not as i expected the story was good common story not as good as Santa Buddies. & I really enjoy talking dog movies but this one was quite poor. the movie seem to focus around a Boy & his mom more so  then Beethoven. (Hence the title of the movie) & the other dogs. it was one of those movies where they made the commercial seem like it was really cool. Sad in a way because it kinda was leading in the Home Alone theme. involving two thieves in a toy store. wish Christmas movies would stop copying such a wonderful 90s Film that will never be re made into anything else.
This was probably my least fav Talking dog movie. I saw too less of Beethoven.
